com.tencent.tcr.sdk.api

Interface TcrEvent


  • public interface TcrEvent
    Session event definitions
    See Also:
    TcrSessionListener.onEvent(String, String)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String EVENT_ARCHIVE_LOAD_STATUS
      Event: The server distributed the archive loading status.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_ARCHIVE_SAVE_STATUS
      Event: The server distributed the archive saving status.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_CLICK_TEXT_FILED
      Event: The hit status of the cloud input box.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_CLIENT_INPUT_STATUS_CHANGED
      Event: Whether content input is enabled (input enablement status distributed from the cloud)
      static java.lang.String EVENT_FIRST_FRAME_DRAW
      Event: The first frame was rendered.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_GAME_START_COMPLETE
      Event: The status of the game process on the server changed.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_IDLE
      Event: The user was idle (the user didn't perform operations related to button events such as keyboard, controller, and mouse events).
      static java.lang.String EVENT_LOW_FPS
      Event: The frame rate was low.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_RECONNECT_FAILED
      Event: The reconnection failed, and the user could only exit the SDK.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_RECONNECT_SUCCESS
      Event: The reconnection succeeded.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_RECONNECTING
      Event: Automatic reconnection was being performed.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_REMOTE_DESKTOP_INFO
      Remote device desktop information, you can understand the meaning of the parameters through the picture below
      static java.lang.String EVENT_SCREEN_CONFIG_CHANGE
      Event: The configuration of the cloud screen changed (only for the mobile game solution).
      static java.lang.String EVENT_SESSION_STOPPED
      Event: The current session `TcrSession` stopped.
      static java.lang.String EVENT_STATS
      Event: The performance data was refreshed.

      • EVENT_LOW_FPS

        static final java.lang.String EVENT_LOW_FPS
        Event: The frame rate was low. The frame rate reached the threshold specified by `TcrSessionConfig.Builder.lowFpsThreshold(int, int)`. Message: None
        See Also:

      • EVENT_GAME_START_COMPLETE

        static final java.lang.String EVENT_GAME_START_COMPLETE
        Event: The status of the game process on the server changed.

        Message:

         
 {
     user_id: "The user ID",
     game_id: "The game ID",
     app_id: number,
     request_id: string,
     status: number  // The game start error code. Valid values: `0`: Started the game successfully;
                    // `1`: Failed to start the game; `2`: The game status changed from not running to running;
                    // `3`: The game status changed from running to not running.
 }
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_ARCHIVE_LOAD_STATUS

        static final java.lang.String EVENT_ARCHIVE_LOAD_STATUS
        Event: The server distributed the archive loading status.

        Message :

        
 {
     user_id: "The user ID",
     game_id: "The game ID",
     name: "The eventual filename of the archive",
     url: "The archive download address",
     status: number, // The error code of the archive loading status.
                     // Valid values: `0`: loaded the archive successfully; `1`: Failed to download the archive;
                     // `2`: Failed to verify the archive; `3`: Failed to extract the archive; `4`: Other error;
                     // `5`: The archive was being downloaded.
     save_type: "`Auto` or `Normal`",
     category_id: "The category ID",  // The archive category ID
     archive_size: number,  // The archive size
     loaded_size: number  // The size of the downloaded archive
   }
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_ARCHIVE_SAVE_STATUS

        static final java.lang.String EVENT_ARCHIVE_SAVE_STATUS
        Event: The server distributed the archive saving status.

        Message:

        
 {
   user_id: "The user ID",
   game_id: "The game ID",
   name: "The eventual filename of the archive",
   md5: "The MD5 value of the archive",
   status: number,  // The error code of the archive saving status.
                   // Valid values: `0`: saved the archive successfully; `1`: Failed to save the archive;
                   // `2`: Failed to compress the archive; `3`: Other error; `4`: The archive was being uploaded;
                   // `5`: The archive could not be found; `6`: The archive operations were too frequent.
   save_type: "`Auto` or `Normal`",
   category_id: "The category ID",  // The archive category ID
   archive_size: number, // The archive size
   saved_size: number // The size of the saved archive
 }
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_CLIENT_INPUT_STATUS_CHANGED

        static final java.lang.String EVENT_CLIENT_INPUT_STATUS_CHANGED
        Event: Whether content input is enabled (input enablement status distributed from the cloud)

        Message :

        
 {
   status: "disabled"  // If the status distributed by the cloud is `disabled`, input is disabled.
 }
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_SCREEN_CONFIG_CHANGE

        static final java.lang.String EVENT_SCREEN_CONFIG_CHANGE
        Event: The configuration of the cloud screen changed (only for the mobile game solution).

        Message :

        
 {
   orientation: "landscape",  // The orientation of the cloud device.
                             // Valid values: `landscape`: Landscape mode; `portrait`: Portrait mode.
   "width": 1920,  // The width of the video image resolution
   "height": 1080  // The height of the video image resolution
 }
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_CLICK_TEXT_FILED

        static final java.lang.String EVENT_CLICK_TEXT_FILED
        Event: The hit status of the cloud input box.

        Message :

        
 {
   "filed_type": normal/auto_login/disable  // The hit status. Valid values:
                                           // `normal`: A normal inputable text box;
                                           // `auto_login`: A text box supporting automatic login;
                                           // 'disable': Input not allowed.
 }
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_STATS

        static final java.lang.String EVENT_STATS
        Event: The performance data was refreshed.

        Message :

        
 {
   cpu:  string,  // The CPU usage of the remote device
   gpu: string,  // The GPU usage of the remote device
   fps: number,  // The frame rate of the decoded video
   rtt: number   // The round-trip event to STUN
   bitrate: number   // The calculated bitrate of the bytes received over the network
   packetsLost:  number   // The number of discarded packets
 }
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_REMOTE_DESKTOP_INFO

        static final java.lang.String EVENT_REMOTE_DESKTOP_INFO
        Remote device desktop information, you can understand the meaning of the parameters through the picture below 
           
        ┌─────────────────────────────▲──────────────────────────────────────┐
        │                             │               Remote Desktop Screen  │
        │                      app_window_top_offset                         │
        │                             │                                      │
        │◀────────────────────────────┼──────────────────────────────┐       │
        │   app_window_left_offset    │   Cloud APP window you see   │       │
        │                             │                              │       │
        │                             │                              │       │
        │                             │                              │       │
 screen_height                        │                              │       │
        │                             └──────────────────────────────┘       │
        │                                                                    │
        │                                                                    │
        │                                                                    │
        └──────screen_width ─────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

        Message :

        
 app_window_left_offset: int // Offset of the horizontal axis of the remote desktop.
 The picture received locally is an offset picture, so the coordinates to be sent need to be converted
 according to the width of the remote desktop and an offset needs to be added.
 app_window_top_offset: int // Vertical offset of the remote desktop. The image received locally is an offset
         image,
         so the coordinates to be sent need to be converted according to the height of the remote desktop and
         then
         offset.
 screen_width: int // The width of the remote desktop, which is used to calculate the ratio of the local
         and remote coordinate transformations
 screen_height: int // The height of the remote desktop, which is used to calculate the ratio of the local
         and remote coordinate transformations
 cursor_showing: boolean // cursor show status true:showing false:hidden.
         When the remote device mouse is displayed, you need to send absolute （Mouse#onMoveTo(int, int))
         coordinates to the remote device.
         When the remote device mouse is hidden, you need to send relative (Mouse#onDeltaMove(int, int))
         coordinates to the remote device
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
